name: Moab Valley Inn

reviews.title: Excellent place for a good price
reviews.text: This place was great. We stayed for three nights during Jeep Safari Week, and it was clean, and the people were accommodating. VERY clean, spacious in the double queen room, and great hot high-powered shower. Decent breakfast, basically your typical free continental, with some nice fresh belgian waffles though. They are also pet friendly and there is a nice little area with a creek running through it right behind the hotel you can take your dog to and run around a bit. Also some nice trails to run on back there, we went running and found some nice trails & a bike path, this is located right behind the high school too actually. ALSO right across the street from a great brewery and walking distance from grocery stores. HIGHLY recommend!

reviews.title: Greedy management
reviews.text: When I reserved my room a few months ago I was told I could checkout an hour late (so I would have time to shower after the half marathon) when I actually check in and remind them, the front desk (manager) literally laughs at me and says there is no chance. They can't have any late check out because housekeeping works till 3 as it is to make all the rooms ready.

reviews.title: Conference - good location
reviews.text: The other front desk staff I talked to later actually showed empathy and offered suggestions, also stated they didn't know why the managers changed this because in years past they did allow it. There was also another guest there that forgot a toothbrush. Normally, hotels seem to have at least those really cheep brushes to give you in a pinch as a hospitality gift, but this lady was shown to a vending machine to purchase her own.

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.text: On a side note, I left my charger behind. Called the hotel at 1pm to see if they found it, and I was informed the housekeeping staff had already gone home for the day and to try back another time (when I was told the reason I couldn't have late check out was because they work till 3 anyway)

reviews.title: Most excellent for a very large gathering of BASE jumpers!
reviews.text: The hotel itself has paper thin walls, very creaky floors, and dated uncomfortable mattresses. Hope you weren't expecting a good nights sleep. I won't be staying here again.

Great location for Arches, Canyonlands, etc. Rooms are good sized, dated but clean. Sink is in the room with separate shower and commode. You can hear noise from the street (room was on street side), other rooms and above. A/C unit and bathroom fan are loud. Housekeeping always came after 12 noon. Nice to have refrigerator in the room. Wifi worked well except for one night when I found it to be off at about 1 am. Staff are ok, not openly friendly but do the work. I personally didn't care for the breakfast. The bread items were always dry/stale (even at 6 am when the breakfast opens). Also have cold cereal, yogurt, waffle machines, boiled eggs and beverages.
reviews.title: Good Enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think it's a bit overpriced for what you get but most other places in Moab were even higher priced for the time I was in town.
reviews.title: Good Value for the area

reviews.text: This hotel was another spot on a cross country trip, with a day hike at Arches National Park. Only 10 minutes from the park, this hotel has the ideal location in Moab. It is situated next to a good BBQ restaurant and across the street from a general store (grocery essentials) and a brewery. Room was a good size with average decor...comfortable bed and clean! Staff was friendly upon arrival and checkout. Hotel has a pool and a small fitness room. Breakfast buffet was included, which was surprisingly good - toast, hardboiled eggs, yogurt, danish, cereal, fresh waffles, tea, coffee, juice, milk, etc..and it is periodically refilled throughout the morning.
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay

reviews.text: I was here with a group - good place to stay for groups. They set us up in a nice conference room, provided refrigerated water and sodas, power strips on each table for our laptops, etc. Room was nice, roomy, good to spread out. Motel is newly carpeted throughout. Service is friendly. Overall good accommodations.
reviews.title: Slightly older but nice rooms and friendly staff

reviews.text: We stayed at another Moab hotel the previous night and had an unpleasant experience. The Moab Valley Inn was a much better experience. The front desk staff was very gracious- they had some computer issues which they continuously apologized for, but the check-in was still smooth. The room was very spacious and quiet- the furnishings were basic (a fridge is provided but no microwave). The fitness facility, pool and hot tub were well-maintained. The exterior looks a bit run down but it looks nicer inside. The breakfast was good- get there early to avoid large crowds. The attendant at breakfast did a great job keeping items stocked and cleaning the area. I felt that the rate was a bit high but after our bad experience the day before, it was a welcome change.
reviews.title: Nice stay!

reviews.text: My friends and I had plans to visit the national and state parks around the Moab area, and found this hotel to stay in. It was a good place as we only used the hotel for a place to sleep. As the other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms were okay and the walls were thin. Everyone was respectful of one another and noticed it. We didn't have any issues of loud noises at all. The pool and hot tub were nice. We did take an afternoon to relax by the pool and with it being such a hot day, it was worth is. It was located in a nice part of town... close to the downtown area and within walking distance from a few great restaurants. The value of the hotel was within our budget and we were satisfied with our stay there.
reviews.title: Great value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were okay, walls were thin, breakfast was adequate. Either the pillows or the bed ruined my back, and I couldn't stand up straight in the morning!! Pool and hot tub were a little scary looking--the pool was too cold to use. The price was reasonable for the area though.....Loved being across the street from Moab Brewery!!
reviews.title: convenient but dated

reviews.text: Moab is an awful place. it's like being trapped in a red rock pit of despair, but at least I was comfortable. I was recently in Moab for Work and I was lucky enough to stay at the Moab Valley Inn. It's not a perfect hotel, but within my work budget in the awful place which people call Moab., it's one of the best. A good comfortable stay in a nice hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Value in Moab

reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable, rooms were clean, showers were hot, and it was convienent to have a fridge in our room. The walls were thin, as we could hear people talking in the rooms next to us and also in the hallway. Location was excellent as we were within walking distance of many good places to eat. The pool and hot area was nice, but did not have much time to use them. The reason for our trip was to photograph the area. Most of our time was spent exploring the parks in the area, not hanging out at the hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Moab Valley was priced fairly though still an expensive stay in Moab. I have vacationed in Moab for years, first back when I used to Jeep and do the Easter Safari and in recent years I usually stay in Moab on Harley rides. The hotel was clean, the pool and hot tub were awesome after a long days ride. The bed was fair and the room was clean and quiet. This is the third time I have stayed here in the last 10 years or so and i would return again depending on price. I just wish Moab would stop gouging local travelers and expect us to pay what all of the Foriegn travelers pay.
reviews.title: fair price in over priced Moab

reviews.text: Rooms large and functional. Breakfast starts early, is simple but unlimited, not to my taste but most guests seemed happy to tuck in. Popular with families and groups of cyclists, so sometimes facilities like the pool seemed overrun. The best bit of this hotel is the helpful staff. Its a hand location for several good restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Basic but well run

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A little run down, but certainly acceptable. We only stayed one night. McDonald's is right across the street if you need quick food. We had a good complimentary breakfast with lots of choices and attentive staff. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here.
reviews.title: Good breakfast. Acceptable night stay

reviews.text: Basic but clean. Located at one end of Moab this Hotel is a littel bit outdated, furniture, beds and baths are worn out.
reviews.title: Basic but clean. A littel bit outdated. Huge rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Continental Breakfast is not good at all, but you expect that of a continental.
reviews.title: Convenient and comfortable

reviews.text: Rooms are huge and clear, baths small. Price reasonable.
reviews.title: Very accommodating, large room size

reviews.text: I've been on the road for 4 weeks, and it's disappointing to have to write my first negative review.
reviews.title: Disappointed with staff response to problems

likes.disliked: — Noisy room, lack of staff response

reviews.text: First the good points: it's a decent enough property, in a nice setting, albeit on the main road - but set a little back, with a decent pool. The room was well equipped and clean, and everything worked well.
reviews.title: Adequate, ordinary motel

reviews.text: I had 3 issues: the wifi didn't work, and despite regularly drawing this to the attention of the staff, their only response was to promise to reboot the modem. And it wasn't just my own laptop at fault, as their own pc for guest use was also down. Fair enough - I understand that technology sometimes fails. But the staff response was weak.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.text: 2ndly, that evening an intense rumbling and vibration started in my bedroom (220). I went to front desk and asked them to investigate, and the clerk said "Oh, that must be our housekeeper using our laundry room which is directly below your room. I'll make sure she turns it off before too long.(!)"
reviews.title: Still need to improve breakfast facilities & quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 3rd point is my real complaint: at just after 6am, this noise starts up again. I ask the front desk to send the duty manager to my room, and they send me 2 ladies from housekeeping: they work out that it is the hotel drying machines, and undertake to go and stop them. The machines stop and start many times over the next hour. Meanwhile, I am running up phone bills that should not be necessary, but the wifi doesn't work: so by this time I am pretty cheesed off.
reviews.title: Ditto!

reviews.text: This hotel is across from the Moab brewery, which has decent food and a good beer selection.The hotel itself is ok. It's clean but a little dated.The a.c.'s don't work well, they shut by themselves and never quite get to that desired temp.There is a laundry on premises.
reviews.title: review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location in Moab. It's at the south end of town, 5 min walk to a large supermarket but with a smaller one across
reviews.title: Great location, very clean and great pool.
friendly staff, clean motel
reviews.text: the road. The main gift shops and tourist info are about a 10-15 min walk. It's best location for us was that it was opposite Moab Brewery

which is a great pub and restaurant with good prices. As the other bars in town wanted you to 'join' and pay a small price to join to have a drink, this brewery was a welcome relief. The hotel is in a quiet area, although by the main road. Rooms were well sound proofed and the fridge in the room was really useful. The pool is quite large
reviews.title: Best Place To Stay

description: WE LISTENED TO YOU!! We are jumping into a new look for 2014! Moab's best deal! Clean rooms, friendly staff, complimentary deluxe continental breakfast, indoor/outdoor pool and hot tub, free wi-fi, business center, hospitality room and much more! 100% non smoking facility for your comfort. Large, spacious family friendly friendly rooms available. The Moab Valley Inn is conveniently located on Main street in beautiful downtown Moab.
